contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox member of the Knesset | image= PikiWiki Israel 10 e9b145d09f806037b79139c365ed4f24.JPG | birth_date = 5 March 1915 | birth_place = [[Berdychiv]], [[Russian Empire]] | Year of Aliyah = 1924 | death_date = {{death date and age|2009|8|10|1915|3|5|df=y}} | death_place = | Knesset(s) = [[Israeli legislative election, 1965|6]], [[Israeli legislative election, 1969|7]], [[Israeli legislative election, 1973|8]], [[Israeli legislative election, 1977|9]] | party1 = [[Gahal]] | partyyears1 = 1965–1974 | party2 = [[Likud]] | partyyears2 = 1974–1979 | party3 = [[Shinui]] | partyyears3 = 1979–1981 | party4 = Independent | partyyears4 = 1981 }} '''Yosef Tamir''' ({{lang-he|יוסף תמיר}}, 5 March 1915 – 10 August 2009) was an [[Israeli Jews|Israeli]] [[journalist]], [[politician]] and [[lawyer]]. ==Background== Tamir was born in [[Berdychiv]] in the [[Russian Empire]] (now part of [[Ukraine]]) and [[aliyah|immigrated]] to [[Mandatory Palestine]] in 1924. He passed through elementary and high school in [[Petah Tikva]] and graduated from the Law and Economics School at [[Tel Aviv University]]. Between 1935 and 1945 he worked as a journalist for [[Haaretz]], the [[The Jerusalem Post|Palestine Post]], [[Yedioth Ahronoth]], [[Maariv]] and [[HaBoker]], and was a military correspondent during the [[1948 Arab-Israeli War]]. He was a member of the Maccabi Sports Movement, and won three medals in the [[Maccabiah Games]]. ==Political career== Tamir joined the [[General Zionists]] party, and became its general secretary. Between 1965 and 1969 he was a member of the [[Tel Aviv]] directorate as head of the [[Liberal Party (Israel)|Liberal Party]] faction (a merger of the General Zionists and the [[Progressive Party (Israel)|Progressive Party]]). In the [[Israeli legislative election, 1965|1965 elections]] Tamir was also elected to the [[Knesset]] as member of [[Gahal]], an alliance of the Liberal Party and [[Herut]]. Yosef retained his seat in the [[Israeli legislative election, 1969|1969 election]], and again in the [[Israeli legislative election, 1973|1973 election]], before which Gahal had become [[Likud]]. After being elected to the Knesset for Likud again in the [[Israeli legislative election, 1977|1977 election]], Tamir broke away from the party and joined the newly-formed [[Shinui]], a centrist liberal party. However, he soon left his new party and spent the rest of the Knesset session as an independent MK. He was not returned to the Knesset in the [[Israeli legislative election, 1981|1981 elections]]. ==Environmental activism== During his lifetime Tamir founded several environmental organisations: *Council for a Beautiful Israel (1968) *Non-factional Committee for Ecology (1970) *Life and Environment Organization (1975) *Israel Economic Forum on the Environment (1991) He also launched the environmental journal ''Green Blue and White''. Tamir represented the [[Knesset]] at the First [[United Nations]] Conference on the Environment of Man in Stockholm in 1972, and was the Likud representative in the Knesset delegation that visited the [[United States]] Congress in 1975 and the German [[Bundestag]] in 1977. Tamir won several prizes for his environmental activism, including the United Nations Environmental Prize and a Knesset Prize for "Achievements in the Area of Environmental Quality". ==External links== {{Commons category}} *{{Official website|http://www.marsviva.org.il}} *{{MKlink|id=678}} {{Authority control|VIAF=37328731}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Tamir, Yosef | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Israeli politician | DATE OF BIRTH =5 March 1915 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Berdychiv]], [[Russian Empire]] | DATE OF DEATH =10 August 2009 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Tamir, Yosef}} [[Category:1915 births]] [[Category:People from Berdychiv]] [[Category:Israeli Jews]] [[Category:Ukrainian Jews]] [[Category:Ukrainian emigrants to Israel]] [[Category:Jews in Mandatory Palestine]] [[Category:Tel Aviv University alumni]] [[Category:Israeli lawyers]] [[Category:Israeli journalists]] [[Category:Members of the Knesset]] [[Category:2009 deaths]] [[Category:Israeli environmentalists]] [[Category:Soviet emigrants to Israel]] [[Category:General Zionists politicians]] [[Category:Liberal Party (Israel) politicians]] [[Category:Gahal politicians]] [[Category:Likud politicians]] [[Category:Shinui politicians]]
